text:
Central Park - Entrances: The Maine Monument located at the S. W. corner of the park as entered from Columbus Circle.

1913

Gift of Urbrock Collection
H. N. Tiemann, photo
title: Manhattan: Central Park entrance at Columbus Circle.

text:
Columbus Circle, southeast sector, from Central Park South (West 59th Street), across Broadway to Eighth Ave. (right), as viewed southward from a vantage point on Broadway; above West 60th Street. The 20-story structure shown is the United States Rubber Company Building, No. 1784-1790 Broadway, at the S.E. corner of West 58th Street. Note on the right the excavation for the General Motors Building which will occupy the block bounded by Broadway and Eighth Ave., West 57th to 58th Streets.

About 1924.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Central Park South - 59th Street (West) - Broadway - 8th Avenue.

text:
Columbus Circle: A set of 2 views forming a panoramic arrangement of the easterly half of these arterial crossroads as viewed eastward. To the left is Central Park; through the center, Central Park South (W. 59th St.), and to the right are buildings extending to Eighth Ave. Broadway, running on a tangent, separates the last two thoroughfares. Upon the site there shown with rodeo billboards, a modern twin apartment building is being completed in March of 1940. This is the old Ehret (Brewing) Estate property.

October 5, 1939
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Easterly half.
